Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas d
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in centrum. Great price of what you get! Nice the ist only for guest. Come back very soon. Thanks Andrew!!! Seen you all. Regards Tom

Reviews.Title: “small, clean, functional”
Reviews.Author: Psolanky
Reviews.Content: we got the double corner bedroom, the room was tiny. however, the hotel and room itself had been recently refurbished, it was immaculately clean, as was the bathroom. the staff were helpful and cheerful, and the location was brilliant. a good hotel if you want something simple, clean and in a very handy location. the photos on the hotels website are actually how the rooms look!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: layal1987 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, we didn't know what to expect. We were welcomed by a nice man who was very kind and helpful. He told us that if we didn't like the room, he would change it for us. We went up to room 404 and I must say for the price it was very clean, big and just perfect. Being both girls we did only have one complaint and that was were the mirror was positioned. We received towels etc everyday and all the staff were always friendly and always willing to help. The location was ideal as it was very close to the station and the red light district. I would defo return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deric S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a definite budget hotel, but it's very centrally located. Less than a 10 minute walk from the central station. Very close to the coffee shops and red light district and other attractions. The hotel concierge, Andrew, was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Two star, not three star”
Reviews.Author: JanStenberg
Reviews.Content: Good location, if you are in for a visit to the Red Light District, otherwise, stay a bit further away. Friendly staff. Cold room and bathroom, clean but in need of refurbishment. A bit too low for my taste, I will find a better hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: csammut
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, clean and comfortable. the staff VERY very helpful indeed. Did not have b'fast at hotel as just across the road there's a very beautiful cafe where you can have english b'fast for around â‚¬10. Don't expect a big room but what makes this hotel so advantageous is that it's almost first hotel you'll stumble upon once you get out of train station. Close to red light and dam square and most importantly the train station. If i had to return i'd surely want to stay there again. The very friendly receptionist (all of them are!:)) told me that now they're planning on refurbishing the hotel so will probably get even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laura01_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect for our last nights stay in Amsterdam. Very close to the train station which we used to get to the airport. Many good restaurants, coffeeshops and souvenier shops all within walking distance. The bathroom was remodeled and very clean. The rest of the room was average. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: nirnatan
Reviews.Content: The hotel located 5 minutes from dam's square and from the central station. A great street worth a lot of ggod restaurants and cofeeshops. The room is big and comfortable and the stuff are very kind and love to help.

Reviews.Title: “Definitly not 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_002_10
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, tiny bathrooms, small shower, thin walls, old TV, old furniture, air condition did not work properly, very expensive (about 150 EUR) without breakfast. The only positive - location near central station and free internet in the rooms. Hotel's pictures in the internet is nice, but it's not true. So, if you can afford - better try to find decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but tolerable”
Reviews.Author: Paul0326
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 2 nights there. People at reception ignored you most of the time. Breakfast was ok but we had only hardboiled eggs not fried or scrambled. Excellent bakeries just down the street. I would skip the breakfast as it is only available after 8 and that is too late if you need to get an early start. Room was dark and barren. 4 naked light bulbs of about 15 watt each was your source for light. The only place bright enough to read was in the bathroom. WI-Fi service never worked in our unit and when I complained I was told that's the way it was, sometime not working. Convenient location but busy at night and on the weekends. Cleanliness ok but hallway all beat up and scratched on walls. Needed a paint job.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time staying and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: HELEN130460
Reviews.Content: On arrival got a great warm welcome, staff are very friendly and helpful, great location, quiet cosy Hotel, 24 hour bar, nice to relax on arrival home, met some great guests here also. Will return and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel as location is best for enjoy Amsterdam and nighlife...”
Reviews.Author: Nipun_world
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a big Hotel , its small and rooms are not big but easy to spend nights . AC , fridge , cattle , is there and whatever you wants can get from the Owner anytime . They are very much kind with customers . Bar is also in the Hotel , if you will entry in the Hotel first and reception is in the Bar . Lot of bars , restaurants of all over world dishes are near by . Lot of shops and Dam square is very near . Casino , Tram , and red light district is also 5 mints walk . But as rooms that are not much comfortable . If you wants to enjoy Amsterdam stay here , if you wants to enjoy Hotels can stay out side of main area . Everything is nearby this Hotel , Central station is around only 5 mintus walk by which can go any where in Europe . I think location is main thing for tourists to save time and when tired too much in the night and wants to come back to your room and your hotel is very near ohhhhhhhh so much relax ....

Reviews.Title: “Pictures online were nice...not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: jasonvan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here recently in August. We booked the hotel off hotels.com and the pictures were very nice. Now it is Amsterdam and we have stayed at a few low quality placesâ€¦so we didnâ€™t have high expectations. When we got there the room was not very clean â€“ right from the dust and derby between furniture, to dirty walls (including some bloody fingerprints on less obvious walls). The sheets left lint balls on our cloths, the white comforter was stained with very dark spots, and it was yellow â€“ the slip over it didnâ€™t hide the filth underneath. The spare comforter in the closet was just as dirty but no slip. And the spare pillow had no case and was equally dirty. We ended up buying our own linins to put on the bed because we didnâ€™t feel clean in the hotels. The towels were very old â€“ in spots they had worn through â€“ they obviously need to be replaced. The staff was pleasant â€“ the location was great â€“ the safe didnâ€™t work â€“ the room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you came to party”
Reviews.Author: Betsylovestravel
Reviews.Content: Headline says it all. Red Light district is pretty safe these days, especially this street. Rooms could be a bit cleaner but they're comfortable, have air conditioning, lots of channels and are in walking distance to everything you need or several tram stops. No crazy staircases like other Amsterdam hotel - they have elevators for us overpacking lazy Americans! Front desk could have actually apologized been a bit friendlier when they made a mistake with my reservation, but I was in Amsterdam without a care and chose not to make a stink. Just double check everything with the front desk and you should be fine. Did you read that? If you're staying here DOUBLE CHECK EVERYTHING regarding your reservation when you check in. Bring your printed reservation information with you. Be the annoying American, who cares, you're in AMSTERDAM and you're supporting their economy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Price - Central for everything.”
Reviews.Author: jdaraf
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at hotel although basic accommodation and rooms the hotel is clean and tidy with good facilities. Very central and has everything on the doorstep. Good security especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: We had a long layover in Amsterdam and wanted a hotel that was close to the train station. The Hotel Luxer was a 3 Star property, and gave us a decent price. However, the location was really the only good thing about this hotel. We arrived at about 9:00 pm, and were leaving at 7:00 am, so we weren't there very long. The TV didn't work, the shower didn't drain (flooding the entire bathroom), the wake-up call was late, and the room was only marginally clean. There were other hotels on the street....I'd look around for a different place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location clean room”
Reviews.Author: chicagoalp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the luxer for one night great location, clean room helpful staff and only 5min walk from train station..this hotel is right in the middle of all the action Rld and all major attraction are within walking distance...

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Linnie61
Reviews.Content: I'm an experienced traveler, but this is the worst hotel I ever saw. Definately not worth 3 stars. I stayed as a single in a double room (???? don't know how you can be in there with 2 persons), small ugly room. When I asked the receptionist for another room he told me it was a standard double room and could only give me a smaller one.... Location very good near central station.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: SteveWoodgate
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Staff pleasant and helpful. Very convenient location. Almost uniquely for hotels in this class the breakfast was worth the price. Range and quality of food was good, and service was exceptional ! Noise - no problem with noise from outside, but sound insulation inside is poor, and the spring door closers are adjusted so that door slamming was a problem. All hotels in Amsterdam are relatively expensive so in general terms this (like all of them) was not good value for money. No hot drink facility in room, although they can be purchased from the bar - but for the price i think they should be free or provided in room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal.”
Reviews.Author: OshBarnett
Reviews.Content: Found this place through laterooms.com and got a massively discounted rate through them, had we payed full price i would not have thought it to be so great to be honest. but i would definately stay again it was in the perfect location, very nice inside with friendly staff and good size room (bigger than expected) which just needed a lick of paint/modernisation, the room didnt fit the rest of the hotel, which was much nicer than the room. I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: KerryNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Asked for an extra bed to be set up as their were 3 adults sharing a room. Trip advisor reviews were good so I took a chance. Well, the bed fell apart. The guest services said there were no more rooms left. We had room 103. Complete nightmare. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “poor from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: MarcJ76
Reviews.Content: Room was small, scruffy and in desperate need of decoration (and cleaning!) Not worth half the price we paid. Constant noise from resturant outside the window along with a TV that didnt work made the visit even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great staff, had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Leightong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxer for 3 nights arriving by train. Its just a short walk from the station on Warmostraat which is a very busy street, and the hotel has a small entrance with its own side street for smoker etc.. You enter the hotel straight into a small hotel bar and through onto the lifts at the rear. We found the staff to be very friendly, always ready to chat and help you out with directions, recommendations etc. We stayed on the 3rd floor which was pretty quiet and the room was very clean and functional. The bathroom and shower were excellent. The location means you're always close to the stuff you went to Amsterdam for as everyone has mentioned. We paid about Â£60 a night and though it was well worth it. Breakfast wasn't included (extra 10 euro) but we slept through anyway. There are some great bars that mainly have locals on Zeedijk - right out of the hotel or left then left again to the old sailor etc.. A great hotel to see Amsterdam from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: GregKo
Reviews.Content: The strong point of this hotel is definitely its location in the heart of the red light district, 5 min walk from central station. The staff was friendly and helpful. Avoid the rooms on the ground floor which are quite small, gloomy and smelly, rooms on the top floors are better and bigger. Not really a good value for money, breakfast is not included.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: morsva
Reviews.Content: Hotel just outside red light district but on a busy street (no cars). The hotel was nice, quiet and clean. The staff we met was good and two of them were very friendly and helped us a lot with things and maps. The hair dryer, water boiler and iron are not in the rooms but can be brougt from the reception. Very close to the station!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TomGarg
Reviews.Content: Plus :perfect location in the center of the city, rooms not small as usual in Amsterdam,bathroom clean and functional.Price very convenient. Minus : room is noisy(heater), breakfast not various, internet connection very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for biz or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Shaun321
Reviews.Content: Superb location just 2 mins from Dam Sq, in buzzy street. Enter and check in at the bar, but its nice! Also open 24 hours for that late drink... Rooms simple but fully functional and clean - with aircon. Nothing to complain about at all especially at EUR 50 per night through GTA Hotels! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: mickums
Reviews.Content: Expensive like all hotels in central Amsterdam and no breakfast included but at least this hotel seemed clean and reasonably comfortable, quiet too despite being located on a very busy street near the seedy red-light district. Good for quick access to central station and just a short walk to Dam Square, Damrak etc. Entrance through a bar seemed a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, regular staff”
Reviews.Author: menonkuwait
Reviews.Content: The location was really good. Almost everything you needed was walking distance. Walking distance from Amsterdam Centraal Station. I was surprised to see a huge bed in the room. I wasn't particularly happy about the view from the room, being a terrace of another building where some guys were barbecuing. The hotel floor was like a maze with a lot of turns and it was really long. The hotel said there was free internet for all, but I couldn't get connected as the signal was extremely weak. The hotel staff gave me usage of a single computer that was kept for browsing. Although the machine was slow, it served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: dreamgirl83
Reviews.Content: Staff were very rude!! Rooms were very unclean. We booked a triple room and got a double room with mattress on floor.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great value and service and situated in the perfect place...”
Reviews.Author: MarkFrater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxer (three gents) in a tripple room (room 311) for 5 nights. After reading some of the other reviews I was a little apprehensive about staying here, but oh how I was wrong... this hotel is PERFECT for anyone (young or old) wanting to experience Amsterdam for all the right reasons (weed, red lights, tours etc). Cleanliness: The hotel was very clean and neat at all times. Room is cleaned/made by the staff daily and fresh towels etc are placed in the room each day. Location: Probably the best part of this hotel is its location, it is 3min walk from the train station and about 5min walk from the busiest red-light district yet the street (warmoesstraat) is not at all seedy and is in fact one of the hubs for coffeeshops/bars/suvinours/food etc. Rooms: Clean, neat, and perfect for a short stay. Service: Excellent, the staff were very helpful and friendly at all times. Value: We asked around at a few other hotels in the area (most of which looked dodgy in comparison) and were shocked to find that most of the "dodgy" ones wanted more than we were paying at the Luxer and were in lesser positions on the "to be" map. Sleep Quality: You're going to Amsterdam and want to sleep? I think you should try another location, Amsterdam is a party city and not for people wanting to wine and dine and sleep. Having said that however, the windows in the hotel do provide a good bit of sound insulation to the outside noise (which will generally go on into the wee hours of the morning, regardless of the day-of-week). Safety: This hotel is very safe and the staff very very trust worthy, we often (in a stoned state of mind) would leave wallets laying around our room and go out to walk the streets and not once did a single penny go missing (even tho staff had clearly been in the room to clean). Internet: Those of you who need to use the internet, the hotel has a PC connected to the net near reception and if its not busy they will generally let you use it for free, otherwise a mere 1 euro for 5min. Food/Drink: The bar/recepetion is also open 24 hours a day and very reasonably priced, they serve snacks too, such as toasties etc. Travel: There is a side alley for safe storage of any bicycles, of which I HIGHLY recommend you hire for the duration of your stay, its the best way to get around and see all of Amsterdam at your own pace and with little physical strain... the walking will kill you eventually otherwise... you have been warned! Coffeeshops: Recommendations... in the same street there are several coffeeshops, I personally liked Hunters (which is a relaxing place with marine aquariums to watch while enjoying your weed). There is also Baba's coffeeshop in the same street, however they music is generally too loud to enjoy when stoned. Greenhouse effect is also in the same street and sells good weed but is a little cramped and music wasnt great. Now for the gem... round the corner is a cafe/bar called Green Light District... they have awesome decor and great varied music (at a nice volume level), they do not sell weed but you are more than welcome to buy your weed elsewhere and smoke it there (be sure to at least buy a coke or coffee). Costs: There are plenty options for those on a budget and those who can afford to dine in the many restaurants. On average you should budget about 12 euro for a decent meal (pizza/pasta/steak/ribs etc) or you can get McDonalds/BurgerKing/similar for around 5-6 euro incl. a drink. Weed will cost you about 10-12 euro per "gram" which will made about 3 joints. Beer etc costs around 4 euro per drink and cool drinks are about 2.50 euro. This hotel is perfect, really, for what you pay it is the BEST you will find! Hope this review has helped you, I know I will certainly be going back!

Reviews.Title: “normal hotel, needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: rk88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Luxer for 3 nights with a friend in May. I was expecting it to be worse actually. Good things about the hotel: 1.Location (close to the central station and red light district) 2. Normal rooms 3. You feel safe ( we were only 2 girls and the staff took care of us and was friendly) 4. Price is good Bad things: 1.Not very clean ( but we were dead tired walking around Amsterdam all day so we only went there to sleep) 2. the shower was not working well 3. I forgot my cell phone there and called them several time, and emailed them but they were so rude and didnt care) 4. Wireless internet had signal only at the lobby, not possible in the rooms However if you go to Amsterdam to have fun and not stay in the room, its a good and affordable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Mikes19
Reviews.Content: Before I left I looked at the reviews of the Luxer Hotel and was a little concerned about what to expect. Firstly the hotel is situated 5 minutes walk from Central Station and one street down from the Red Light area. The twin room was a bit on the small side but was spotlessly clean. There was an ample supply of hot water and plenty clean towels. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much problem for them. If you wanted to know anything it was a case of just asking. I would thoroughly recommed this hotel if they are looking to be close to all the action and want a friendly, clean no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rdanecker
Reviews.Content: The room was ground level overlooking an alley. The pillows did not have cases and there was a pile of dirty linens piled up outside my room. The shower was the size of a coffin and the bath towel was threadbare and had a tear in it. When I asked for pillow cases I was not greeted by the shock I had anticipated but with "We will see if we can find you one". Eventually one was procured with the answer that they had a linen shortage due to the Easter holiday. The staff were good but the room looks nothing like the internet photos. It was conveniently located but even at 60 euro (w/o breakfast) it failed to come close to my very low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GOOD PRICE AND A GOOD OLD CHEESE TOASTY!”
Reviews.Author: TURKEYFOREVER
Reviews.Content: Great location, reasonable price and overall pretty clean! Can't grumble really for a 2 night break. The hotel is situated 2 mins from red light district and not far too walk to any of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “First time I've been scolded for asking for an extra blanket”
Reviews.Author: crimsynthesis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer with a friend while visiting Amsterdam. The only positive: location is really convenient because it is only a few minutes walk from central station. Unfortunately, our room on the ground floor (after a walk through the greasy bar area and dim hallway) was not clean and reeked of marijuana. I used sanitizing wipes to clean things off in the bathroom myself. The door had only a flimsy lock on it, and to be honest, we didn't really feel safe there. The brusque staff scolded us when we asked for an additional blanket at the front desk/bar the next morning. We weren't given one.

Reviews.Title: “Luxer and Luxer Annex - not the same”
Reviews.Author: walk1103
Reviews.Content: In the guide books and online forums, Hotel Luxer receives generally good reviews. I checked availability through EasyToBook online hotel reservations for just a one night stay in September 2009 and received a reply that an "annex" room was available at Hotel Luxer. Further information said that the room was "located on walking distance of the hotel." So, I booked it. When we arrived to check-in, we were led about a block down the street to a narrow alley, and then to a plain, non-descript door in an area that had the faint odor of urine. Upon opening it, we were led up a poorly lit stairway to the second floor, then down an equally dim corridor to our room. The room itself was clean, but there was a flimsy lock on the door and a hole in the bathroom door. The floor of the free-standing closet was broken in half, and there was a hole in back wall of the closet. There also were neither clothes hangers nor chairs in the room. The room lighting, as is the case in most European hotels of this level, was barely adequate. At night it was noisy since our room overlooked the alley and was located near a loud bar. A couple of hours after we went to bed, we heard voices and footsteps approaching our room door, and then somebody fumbling with a key to open the door. We had to yell a couple of times that we were in the room to stop them from opening the door. We then realized from the conversation on the other side that it was an employee trying to show a prospective customer our room. I guess he did not realize it was already occupied. That was another thing wrong with the room...no inside lock on the door. Bottom line - it was okay for one night, but at 108 euros it was expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “What a Shame”
Reviews.Author: LadyPnut
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and never had any complaints, until our last trip for Christmas. We would normally stay somewhere more plush, we thought that as we had stayed here before, it would more than suit our needs. Checked in OK. They let us check in early. Off we trotted to our room! What a shock! The room was small, the window faced the window of someones home, the walls were covered in a mystery paste, the bed-frame had a mystery substance, the TV didn't work. Hubby went and saw the lady that checked us in and showed us how "to use the buttons on the TV". No replacement remote. Room was cleaned the next day and they actually cleaned the bed-frame but not the wall!! Shower was like water being spat on you. Couldn't wait to be home and to have a decent shower after being spat on for 4 mornings. Wouldn't stay here again! They have lost a customer. All this place needs to do is clean up and modernise the place and they will be back on track. Loved the Cat!!

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: gosia-03
Reviews.Content: Rooms don't looks like on web photos ,all rooms are mega dark,and u can hear everything from next rooms. And cleaner love to walking in to your room. But location is amaizing, centre of Amsterdam, just coffee shops, shoping and awsom pubs!!!amaizing location!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, tho' never a 3 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sammygeezer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 5 mins walk from the station, and smack bang in the middle of all the action! You could not ask for a better situated hotel, nestled in between bars, coffee shops and restaurants, the Red Light district is only 100m away, yes this is certainly very well positioned. However, there is no way on Earth this is a 3 star, I have stayed in a lot cleaner 1 star hotels and hostels than this! There were bits of, well I'm not quite sure wot it was, still in the room in the corners, and near the bed. it was prob only the mess from the previous occupants, but was still not nice to see, and a good vacuuming would have sorted it. The staff are friendly enough, tho' we only saw them as we made our way in or out of the hotel. We paid Â£80 a night for a double with en-suite (the missus wont share a toilet or shower!!), so at that price, comparing it to other central located hotels, it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I got disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Joao_Marcos
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam together with my wife, parents and parents in law during the winter 2009. The weather was extremely cold as usual for January, but the trip was very nice anyway. However it could have been even better if I had stayed in anywhere else. I know that it's very diffculty to find affordable accommodation in Amsterdam mainly in the Red Light District and close to the Centraal Station. But, although I got reasonable prices for double rooms (100 EUR + breakfast) I got very disappointed with this hotel. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was fair but my room was dirty and stinking of smoke even though I'd booked a non-smoking room. The previous guest had smoked, used the drawer as ashtray and it was not cleaned before I got into the room. Besides, there were some guests that probably got high and started running through the corridors spreading an unbearable stink of marijuana. Therefore, I don't recommend this hotel for families and couples. In my point of view, the only advantage of staying at Luxer hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel wrecked my holiday!”
Reviews.Author: MISSJ1234
Reviews.Content: The first night we arrived we found Cockroaches in our rooms downstairs told the reception at midnight he said "Oh not again" so they have them all the time the room was filthy the carpet is dirty with dead insects and cockroaches around the room and in the hallways. There were flys in the room, they moved our rooms to the floor up one smelted of vomit no control for the telly and our other room had building work outside our window at 7 in the morning air conditioning was broke the guests are really noisy and the staff are aggresive and rude and ripped us off .

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off”
Reviews.Author: cherriesuk
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time have stayed at this establishment first time ok room all night bar perfect location, this time however aug 130e a night, poxy room window opens to a wall, if you swing a cat he would be dead. In 18 months bar prices have doubled and different prices for same drinks, whisky & coke and a pint 15e I no we were there for the footy but we are not all idiots and dont like being ripped off, shame because the staff are all the same but dont seem to care anymore, others stayning elsewhere for less money and much better.(and cleaner) try crowne plaza

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice room, grate location, too small for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Cristian46
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is that is in the center. We reserved a double room with private bathroom. The pictures from the website look very nice but when we got there the first room that they gave us was incredible small( the room door was opening directly in the bed.We've changed the room and they gave as another one with 2 square meters bigger. The room was cleaned and tidy no complains about this...but for those 262 E for 3 nights we expected something else. We didn't pay for breakfast because we weren't sure that we will be able to wake up till 10 o'clock. We were charged for the whole amount right on our arrival( this looked very strange) and another think that bodered me was that the internet connection was quite expensive. 1 min for 0.20 E.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel so long as you are chilled/laid-back!”
Reviews.Author: KaziaV
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location for the red light district. Accommodation is simple but comfortable. Breakfast is lovely. We would definitely recommend the hotel but you must be prepared for the fact that the staff are all very laid back and may not respond to all guests basic requests. I tend to take my leatherman with me to deal with basic maintenance and we don't mind buying light bulbs and toilet rolls from the supermarket as and when required! We love this hotel (and the staff) but you should only stay there if you are prepared to tune into the laid back way of life in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - will definately come again!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyfun87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Luxer in March 09 for 1 week with my boyfriend and I couldn't recommend a better hotel. At 60 euros a night for a double room it seemed fairly cheap for Amsterdam (some grotty hostels were about the same price). The room was nice, nothing spectacular but what do you expect for that price. The staff were nice and helpful. Overall the best thing about this hotel was the location. It was only a few minutes from Central Station, close to the bars, coffee shops and red light district. For those wanting to visit "cultural Amsterdam" most of the attractions are within walking distance and the public transport is excellent. I will definately stay here again on my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotwl, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: seapoint40
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very enjoyable stay. Nice outer appearance, great bar and reception and on a central road. Not for familes or older couples though as it is in the heart of red light district/ gay area. Staff are a bit hit and miss, one woman even gave me ten euro less change, and when I asked for it, she freaked out in broken english. Most staff are lovely though, very helpful with perfect english, even the maid had a chat with us one morning! Room was big with a nice veiw, tiny bathroom but amazing shower! I would stay here again. Great value for money. If you are away for more than three days, check out Eftleling: http://www.efteling.com

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: sparkyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam hotels in the center are old warehouses, historic, but long and narrow, only a few rooms have windows the rest have air shafts. This hotel was really BAD. Should have realized problem when they asked us to pay in advance. DON'T DO IT. Neighbourhood is tough, single women should not stay here, but close to station. Room was on main floor behind bar. Threadbare carpet , room run down and drab. Furnishings wornout, linens not that clean, Bathroom had moldy smell. No window only airshaft. Sewer smell was strong, dissipated if window at bottom of shaft opened, but mosquitos came in, and were terrible in the night. If you stay here bring BUG SPRAY; we had welts for a week. No light bulb strong enough to allow reading in the room, only one chair. Black hole of Calcutta came to mind. Expected more for 126 Euros, booking months in advance. Left after two nights, went to NH Hotel around corner for 196 euros (a palace in comparision), a little more than we wanted to spend, but worth it after the Luxor experience. They promised to refund out last nights prepayment when we left early. What do you think happened??

Reviews.Title: “Great location clean, warm and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ShaneandRose
Reviews.Content: This friendly hotel is just across from the Central Station and on the fringe of the red light district. You can walk to many of the attractions or catch a bus or train from the station. The breakfast is really great and the staff friendly and helpful. The room was quite small and the bathroom tiny but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Buy a holland pass for transport and attraction entrances. We felt vey clever when we skipped the queue at the Van Gogh exhibition. The church bells rang at anytime of day or night but just soak up the culture and the atmosphere. We went on a free walking tour of the red light district and it was fun, informative and interesting. We styed clear of the coffee shops and cafes. We are not that adventurous!

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, not a great area though”
Reviews.Author: leafchick
Reviews.Content: nice and close to train station which was handy but not a great location otherwise. room was clean and a good size as was the bathroom. most of the people at reception were nice and helpful,

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Watch out for 'Big Dutchie'”
Reviews.Author: Jack_mj
Reviews.Content: Big Dutchie being the guy who i think owns the place.He big and quite scary but generally a good bloke by the look of it.Overall the location of this hotel was good but the staff are abit rude.Not so much to our group but others seemed to get treated badly.The rooms stink of ganja yet it is said they are 'non smoking' and rooms backing onto the main strip can be quite loud! The room was generally clean and the showers hot. All you really need for a hotel in dam. Prices are a little high (Maybe this was because it was New Years Eve) but at least we avoided the nightmare of other hotels that offer cheap prices. The Lobbby is smart and warm (with a bar) and we noticed rarely very busy (unlike the rest of dam which is heavvving most of the time.so its a good place to come back to if it all gets too much.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CurlyC2
Reviews.Content: We paid aprox Â£90 per night at the Luxer for a triple room. It would have beem cheaper at other times but because of the week pound against the Euro, the exchange rate was not in our favour. The location is right bang in the middle of the coffee shops, cafes, etc and only a 4 minute walk from central rail station. This is great but comes with that is the issue of noise. We had to be moved from our first room as the noise (from the street) went on ALL through the night and we didn't get a minute's sleep - I don't think the windows are double-glazed. We got moved to a room on the ground floor at the very back of the hotel, which was a little bit dingy-like, but very quiet. The rooms are very basic and the beds quite old, squeaky and uncomfy - but it's fine for a couple of nights with your mates. I've not stayed in any other budget hotels in Amsterdam so can't compare - but from reading the other reviews, it appears that this hotel is one of the better ones. The front door is locked and we (a group of 3 young girls) did feel safe enough in the hotel although we thought the staff were a bit on the 'dark' side. There was a very large man who manned the front desk each night and was always watching 'Men & Motors' on the TV behind the desk! All in all, it's fine for a short, budget break but if I were going back to Amsterdam, I'd pay more to pay somehere a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mad_Scotsman1952
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel and found the room to be very clean and comfortable, the Staff were very helpfull and nothing like the other reports we had read. We will definetly be staying there again when we visit next, the Hotel is sited right in the very centre of Amsterdam, railway sation less that 5 mins walk away. well sited for the Dam and everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Stag do digs....”
Reviews.Author: hughesy01
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at the Hotel Luxer out of a group of 45 on a stag do this month. Location - perfect spot, only 5 mins walk from Central Station, 2 mins from the Red Light area and Bars/Restaurants on your door step. Near to the more commercialised boozers such as the Grasshopper but also close to more local haunts such as the 'Backstage Bar'.... plenty to do all within few minutes walk. Check In - stated on booking confirmation check in from 2pm, however we went straight to hotel at 10am to put our bags in and much to our surprise we were allowed to check in our room, so that was handy. Lady on reception friendly enough. Room - we had a triple room, 3 single beds, not a huge room however was big enough to get our heads down come the early hours and thats all that we needed really so can't complain. Room was clean and tidy, as was the bathroom. Shower was a bit odd but worked so again, no complaints. Its not luxury but for lads or lasses on a weekend away the hotel is fine. The Hotel does have a 24 hour bar however to be honest we didn't use it for we'd all had enough by the time we came back to the room so can't comment on service etc.. all in all a good stay, would definately stay here again in the future for the location and price...

Reviews.Title: “Staff extremely rude!”
Reviews.Author: TheDON81
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? 6 people with 3 double rooms. Rooms were not finally ready for us until 6pm the day we arrived, after calling at 1pm to check in we had to leave our bags and we had 5hours to waste before they were ready. Staff didnt seem to care! Some of the rooms the air con was not working. When it came to checking out, thats where the fun started.....not! The receptionist threatened to phone the police as we were just over an hour late checking out, I explained to her about our checking in problem and again she didn't care, she argued her point until the end. I will not be staying at this hotel again and I would advise other people the same. Location is good but there are plenty of other hotels around that are centrally located and would be 100 times better!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything, little shaky at times”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Part of our grande EU tour and my 13 year old son and I decided to head to Amsterdam for 2 nights and it was certainly eye opening for us both. The Hotel Luxor proved to be a good choice as it was a 5 minute walk from the train station (parked in a suburb and trained it in). price was right @$150e per night so we wnet for it. Right in the heart of the coffeeshops and blocks from the red light district. At the same time we found good restaurants w/in a 5-10 min walk. Hotel check in was easy, they tried to sell breakfast but we declined which was good as there was plenty of good breakfast places nearby. The lobby which is fairly small w/ a bar was packed throughout the stay but not by a bar crowd. Mostly local people conducting some sort of business and it was so crowded, we had to push our way through every time we walked through. Room was very small w/ two single beds, a small desk area and a window that opened up to an alley. The room never cooled down in a fairly hot period of July weather. It was tough to sleep through because of the heat, although, we were never bothered by any noise..Bathroom was also small but clean. Pillows and linens were sub-par but OK. Couple of arguments in the hallway throughout the stay, believed it was simply couples who had too much to drink and were not getting along. It was an OK hotel in a pinch and the location basically says you aren't going to miss any of the local attactions. albeit, go to Paris if you want sights and culture.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: dlhrangersfc
Reviews.Content: This was me and my friends 5th trip to amsterdam and thought we would try the luxer after passing it on previous trips, Good points Hotel itself is in a great location only 2min walk from central station and right in the middle of all the bars and cafes and the red light is just round the corner although you cant see it from the hotel. Really quite at night so you can get a great sleep after walking for hours and the bathroom was very clean, bed was ok, 24hour bar but was never busy so no noise. The bad points now. Staff were the rudest i have ever met and im no snob. It was as if everything was too much trouble for them, Then they tried to charge us more for the room even though i had the booking form in my hand with the price on it!!! The guy on recieption at night is like a bear with a sore head. All in all good hotel, if they employed some friendly staff then it would be a great hotel, wont be back, much prefer the nadia hotel even though it is a 10min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel surrounded by red light district”
Reviews.Author: Aphishionado
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the Orbitz price. I was a bit weary wondering if this would be just another red light district hotel but i was proved wrong. This hotel is a Gem! clean, small room. good bathroom. comfortable double bed. great sky lite for fresh air. didn't do the breakfast - walk 5 min out the door to the left and you pass 3 super dank bakery joints that have scrumptious real breakfast for under 7 euros a person. it's a 10min walk door to door from the station but the location is EASY - i mean SUPER EASY to find - which is important late night for any tourist in amsterdam. catch any tram back to the station and you can easily find your way home - not a bad trade off for the proximity to public transit. street was cleaned every morning. hotel staff: super protective and professional - felt very safe here - very pleasing for amsterdam. stay here for the value

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kateyk8
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right in the heart of Amsterdam but on a quiet enough street to ensure a great night's sleep. Service was great, we were welcome to leave our bags under their watchful eyes so that we could spend our last day in Holland unfettered. The only thing that could have made it better would have been tea & coffee facilities in the room & maybe a small fridge. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean and Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katkeane
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the centre of Amsterdam, near the main train station and in somewhere clean and not too pricey then this is the perfect hotel! The bar downstairs when you walk in makes it feel a bit seedy, but it was never busy or loud. The rooms are air conditioned, clean and a good size so we couldnt complain compared to some three stars we stayed in over our trip! If you want to get to the red light district then when you come out of the hotel head down one of the lanes facing the hotel and it will take you to the main strip so you are right beside it, but it is a safe area! The hotel also has internet though it is quite expensive! There is a free tour (they work for tips) which leaves from the main square at 11.15 and I would recommend it as you get all the sights in detail. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: samsazzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Luxer in Amsterdam for 4 nights. It was easy to find and a fantastic location bordering on the red light district within easy reach of the pubs and coffee shops. Nice clean accommodation with large air conditioned room. Did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miles-singleton
Reviews.Content: An ok Hotel very central for pubs cafe and red light if want to be in the middle of it all 2 mins from the station this could be the place for you, Rooms very basic but clean and tidy place

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Luxer for 3 nights as we were over for an event in the Amsterdam Arena. Loved this hotel, was very clean and the bathroom was lovely. One of the girls who worked on reception wasnt very polite but all the rest were lovely! Although it says its in the RLD, its actually a short walk away, you cannot see any girls in windows from the hotel, or in the street the hotel is on! Its a 2 minute walk from all the hustle and bustle, meaning that it is generally quiet. And also a very short walk from Central Station. When i return to Amsterdam i will be staying in this hotel. I really dont understand why people are giving negative reviews?! Oh and also....we got a drink from the bar at about 6am no problems, on our way back from the event that we were attending on the Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AssiP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel luxer for 3 nights, 4 guys in our 20's. We had low expectations from the hotel, but it was just what we needed! The rooms were OK, bigger than the average for such low-priced hotels and clean. The staff was friendly, though not very helpful. We found it easy to get by in the city without their help. Now the location - it was perfect. Just in the edge of the centre, very close to a variety of restaurants, bars and cofee shops. Less than 5 minutes by foot from Dam square, 7 minutes from the central station, 5 minutes from the main shopping area, yet our rooms were very quiet. Don't expect anything fancy. I will definently stay there again, but not for a honeymoon or another special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Luxer did us right”
Reviews.Author: chocdog
Reviews.Content: Great location from Central Station - do not take a taxi - you can walk here easily from the train. I disagree w/ other comments about this hotel (area) being noisy. It was generally quiet and you're not directly in the heart of all the action since it is at the beginning of the street. The room was clean and cleaned daily. I do agree w/ previous comments that the staff was hit or miss / some were nice others where just quiet. People don't really hang out at the bar, so don't worry about that... although you can get a drink 24/7. I did get a key to the room safe and when I checked out I wasn't given my 20 euro deposit immediately... I had to ask for it. Kinda felt like they were trying to get my last 20 euro, but they did kindly return it when I asked for it. This is not a 5 star hotel, but they don't claim to be that. If you're looking for a clean hotel w/ a great location - pick the Hotel Luxer. And as a bonus - Coffeeshop 36 is right down the street / stop by for a visit - you will be happy you did. Also - we went on a canal dinner cruise / probably the best thing we did in Amsterdam - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but I probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: alone_in_a_crowd13
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Luxer last week and while it wasn't a bad hotel, I don't think I would stay there again. This isn't really the fault of the hotel or it's staff but mainly due to it's location. Given it's close proximity to the Red Light District and all the infamous coffeeshops, it's not exactly the place you want to stay if you want an undisturbed night of sleep. This was my problem though, I should have thought this through when I booked my hotel in Amsterdam. On the plus side, the hotel was very clean, room wasn't huge but was big enough for me. The room had air conditioning which was great. On the downside, the hotel's internet access was nearly useless, the staff ranged from extremely helpful and friendly to others who were dismissive. All in all, I'd say if you're just going to Amsterdam to party or whatever, then the Luxer probably isn't a bad choice of a hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “luxer ain`t luxurious”
Reviews.Author: treeehugger
Reviews.Content: The taxi really couldn`t have dropped us off much nearer. The RLD is mostly pedestrianised apart from bikes and service vehicles. The hotel itself is in the midst of the RLD where we had booked to be. Soooo we checked in and the credit card was swiped and everything seemed good and we held out our eager, tired hands for our keycard, only to be told that there was a problem with our room and we were to be given alternative accomodation elsewhere. "only 5 minutes away". Eventually someone came 30minutes later and led us on a 20 minute trail to a dodgy looking bedsit which I`m not sure even had windows, only to be then told if we wanted breakfast we would need to go back to the hotel! To cut a long story short, we stomped backed to the Luxer where the receptionist grudgingly gave us the key to another room in the hotel but said it was for people yet to book in. We weren`t pleased but were tired so acccepted, but apparently she gave us an incorrect key for an occupied room. Eventually we recieved the correct keycard for an empty room. The room was very basic and could do with a few lessons from budget hotels who know what they are doing. This is not three star as most people would know it. Try 1 or 2 star at 4 or 5 star prices. Forget a view, but we did have fun re-naming the tv channels. Next day whilst indulging in a siesta, the intended occupants (we assume) entered our room. Thankfully, they had the sense to about turn and leave! All through or stay we were making trips up and down to reception to have our key re-activated. Very annoying. Important Stuff. The rooms were clean enough. The cleaner was an English man and the toilets were spotless and the towels changed daily. The air con was rubbish. I wasn`t particularly impressed by the buffet breakfast. Although the fruit, when there was fruit, was welcome. Amsterdam is VERY VERY VERYexpensive, especially for drink and very very seedy. We were constantly being asked by various individuals if we were looking for Charlie. In the RLD, there are mainly 4 kinds of shop - coffee, pub, restaurant and sex stuff. 3 days were enough. I`d like to go back to Amsterdam one day and do the museums. But I won`t be booking this hotel again. Especially when there are familiar chain hotels nearby such as the Ibis which is right next to the train station. Book really early. P.S. my other half has just proofed this article and said I was very generous. Words mentioned were "piece of ****" and "don`t do it!" Not about my article, about the hotel, I believe!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money!”
Reviews.Author: fraatzie
Reviews.Content: After reading many many many reviews I was not sure what to expect from this hotel. I went in open minded and was pleasently suprised when we got there. It was not bad at all. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, all was well. Would stay there again with no problems. It is very centrally located!

Reviews.Title: “u'll be in bed b4 midnite”
Reviews.Author: michelle055
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average . The walls are not very sound proof , some staff were lovely . The rooms were small & cleaned daily . We didn't have any breakfast there, it's cheaper to get it some were else .The location was perfect. 5 mins walk from centeral station.Streets are very small.so you wont need taxis or the tram.everything is on your door step. Great steak house 2 doors up, expensive but mouth watering.Great pubs (Dirthy Nellys) and beer not expensive, â‚¬4- â‚¬4.50 for a pint. And â‚¬3.60 bottles. Loads and Loads of coffee shops on that street .and the red light district just 2 minute walk. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: tommo1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here and the location was fantastic. Only a short walk from Central Station and minutes from the Red Light District and Dam Square. Rooms were nice enough - clean and average size. Breakfast was not up to scratch for 10 Euro's each - managed to knock together beans on toast but the rest was pretty poor. Try the Drink and Sink bar just accross the street for a better Breakfast. Hotel would have got higher marks if not for the staff. They had messed up our booking and tried charging us for a room we had already paid for. The night barman was horrible - the hotel advertises a 24 hour bar but almost every guest we saw enter late at night was refused service for being too drunk. He was particularly rude to guests spitting out 'I will not be serving YOU!' rather than suggesting someone may have had enough. This caused particular offence to many guests we saw. If I was to visit again I would look at some of the hotels nearby and use this as a last resort. The weekend was made by the Drink and Sink bar opposite and Kathlene in particular who was fantastic company.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: me.xxx
Reviews.Content: we had no problems with the luxer hotel althougth it is defintely not a 3* , rooms were quit small but clean, tv with english chanels, bathroom ok size but no hair dryer. we were next to a loud genarater all night... not that is bother me coz we were to sleppy ...lol...the location is exellent 5 mins from central station, and next to cafes, coffe shops ect. would defo go back!!! xx liverpool

Reviews.Title: “Shady Luxer”
Reviews.Author: Spleam08
Reviews.Content: It took me and my mate a while to find this hotel, mainly because we couldn't read a map! Plus it was dark when we arrived....and we'd knocked back a few beers earlier..... Anyway the hotel is tucked away in a narrow road right next door to the Red Light District. It is opposite the central station - about a 3 minute walk. Can't fault the location. Staff who check you in arn't very friendly, but they are there if you need them. Hotel is ok, nothing luxury but a good enough place to get your head down for a couple of nights. Agree with all the other comments about the dirty carpets - and the whole place reeks of stale smoke. You can't open the window in the room - so its not the freshest smelling place. Bathroom was nice and clean though, and the telly worked. We wern't disturbed by any noise at all, I had trouble sleeping but that was self inflicted! Hardly spent any time in the hotel, there's lots to do in Amsterdam but this visit was purely to see the Arctic Monkeys (& Reverend & The Makers) play at the Heineken Music Hall - which was [--] class! Probably would stay here again as the location is good. P.S - Stay away from white widow ;-)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stacey1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxer Hotel for 3 nights , and was very pleased with my choice. Rooms are clean a little small but you get use to it, towels got changed once in 3 days but you do get 4 towels when you arrive. It has a lift so great for when you're not in the hiking upstairs mood. The shower is ok, takes a while to get the temperature right, not the biggest bathroom, but enough room. We were in room 303 which was on the top floor in the middle, not much noise apart from the annnoying church bells that go off every 15 minutes!! Staff are quite friendly did'nt spend much time at the bar, as the drinks are so expensive (like most of Amsterdam) We paid 252 euros to stay from the friday to the monday. I read reviews about the hall carpet being horrible and tatty. IT REALLY ISNT THAT BAD!! yeah there's a few rips in it but thats about it. The hotel is a 5 min walk from Dam Square with the red light district on your door step with many side street pubs. The clubs are very far away though, about 40 mins walk. Good points: close to Dam Square, clean, smoking rooms, lift, 5 mins walk from the train station, holding area for luggage, doors in room lock automatically Bad points: Too far away from clubs, had to check out at 11am (too early for me)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!! Nice hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Toronto-girl25
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Europe for 2 weeks in July 2007. Our first stop was Amsterdam and we stayed at the HOTEL LUXOR. It looks a little seedy but we felt safe. We knew this hotel was a 3 star so our expectations were average. CHECK IN Check in time was noon but we arrived very early in the morning as we took the red eye from toronto. Our room wasn't ready yet so we were told to wait. The front desk/ bar told us they would watch our bags if we wanted to walk around the streets to familarize ourselves with the city. We returned around 11am and our room was ready for us. The hotel looks a little seedy but it was great. You had to get buzzed in so we felt added security made it less seedy ROOM Room was a nice size. Two Twin beds, a desk and chair and a large washroom. The shower didn't have a shower curtain so it confused us as at first.. The room had A/C which was great if it was warmer. With added blankets it was perfect. HOTEL LOCATION. 2 minutes from the train station. in the heart of the red light 2 minutes from Damn street 15-20 min walk to the bar/club area. Or you could take the bus or cab. We chose to walk everywhere. 5 minutes from shopping areas 10 minutes from Anne Franks House. Many amazing restaurants right on the street. Go to the Mexican restaurant. Yummy fajitas and salsa. Other amazing shops and sites to see. Conclusion. Great place to stay. Great location. Glad we stayed in the heart of the red light. Not as seedy as I thought it was going to be. I would go back. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 147Matty147
Reviews.Content: Well located and easily found from Dam Square (from centraal station head to Dam Square (signposted) and take a left next to Europub and Grand Krasnapolsky. (On to Warmoesstraat) Walk for approx 500-600m past a host of coffeeshops and the hotel is situated on your right. I stayed for one night in a standard single room for approx 43GBP, which was very competitive having done a detailed web search for accomodation before booking this hotel. The room was clean and basic with en suite facilities. It would be unfair to state that the staff as a whole were unhelpful, but the one female receptionist with whom I spoke was arrogant, cocky and unhelpful. The real plus point of the hotel is the location - right in the hub of the centre. The red light district is a short stroll away, but just far enough so as to not be exposed to its seedier element. All in all a fair result for the price - I would recommend this hotel on that basis.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller028
Reviews.Content: hotel is right in centre off the damrak which is opp centraal station. it's a clean, friendly hotel. our room was small but comfy, breakfast (payable at hotel) was good and plenty of it. hotel situated ideally for sightseeing, shops, pubs, red light, canal trips. opposite centraal station is the tourist information we bought a map for 2 euros which was well worth it. would defintely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again. well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Worst”
Reviews.Author: Marmion44
Reviews.Content: A homeless person wouldn't stay here. The staff were unfriendly, the entry through a seedy bar was disgusting, the carpeting and upholstry old and worn, the furniture second hand rejects. And those are the good points!! Having paid 'big bucks' in advance we tried to tolerate this terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “despite everything we'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: dragonmummy1
Reviews.Content: we were a small party of women, ranging in age from 30's to 60s. The hotel is situated right in the middle of the red light district, which we loved! We felt safe and it was fun and interesting. Our room was in the ground floor annexe and was fairly small and with none of the facilities advertised, except for a TV (which we never even switched on). One of our party managed to get a kettle from the staff and we provided our own tea/coffee etc. The room was clean but the carpet, and the carpet in the corridor, was filthy and tattered. We were told it's going to be replaced, but estimates of when vary from "next week" to "before Christmas". The bar is open 24 hours, but has no ice and no lemon/lime, but staff are charming and relaxed and don't mind if you provide your own! In fact, the staff are so laid back, some might regard them as casual to the point of being offhand. But the lovely Natalie will share her takeaway with you, and the night porter, Jeff, doesn't mind if you chat to him all night (just don't offer him flowers!). The rates aren't particularly a bargain - we paid 220 Euros (including tax) each for 3 nights sharing a basic room for 3 persons. Breakfast is good value at 10 Euros, with a wide self-selection. If you're broadminded and relaxed then this hotel wins out by being right in the heart of the action!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotell!!!”
Reviews.Author: waura
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Hotel Luxer. There was a group of 9 of us and we werent expecting luxury but we were plesantly surprised. The rooms were clean and relatively large. The bathroom was clean and functional. Lovely staff the maids are amazing they work so hard and smile so much!! Give them a tip it is well worth to see the smile after!! Breakfast was good. All in all great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but good enough”
Reviews.Author: lizzlebob
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a great location for sight seeing, you do have to walk past quite a few 'coffee-shops' and sex shops to get there. The breakfast seemed rather expensive at 10euros per person when all we wanted was cereal, so we didn't get that, if you want a full breakfast every day it would be fine if a little expensive. The hotel is fairly shabby in places, there were quite a lot of brown stains on the walls and carpets. It was also really noisy for the first couple of nights with people coming back in from their nights out, but I guess that is inevitable in this kind of area. The art work in the room leaves a lot to be desired. The bathroom is excellent, and the shower is really good. The tvs are good, but because they seem to be in the far corner of the room away from where you are sitting, you have to have them quite loud and so you can hear everybody else's. We were in a ground floor room, so felt like we had to have the curtains closed the whole time to prevent anyone from seeing in. So, all in a all a very good place to crash if you don't have children and you're not fussed about a few stains and people being noisy. Apologies if my review seems a little contradictory, but there were pros and cons to staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, near everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: famezzz
Reviews.Content: Luxer Hotel is a newly renovated hotel, quiet, clean with helpful staff. Rooms are simple and cute with satellited TV, and private bathroom/WC. It has a good breakfast within the price. It is near everything. Central station is 7 minutes walk. Shops, restaurants, coffeeshops, dam square is near! Highly recommended for everyone despite age.We stayed there only for a night, but if we get the chance to come again for vacations in Amsterdam it will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for couples!”
Reviews.Author: Boxxer
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with Venere.com, was a little aprehensive at first given some of the poor reviews, but the rate was reasonable and the location seemed ideal. Upon arrival the bar/reception of the hotel appeared nice and it's indeed only 5 minute (if that) walk from Central Amsterdam Station! It is close to the red light district but not in the red light district, we didn't hear any noise in our rear facing room! Staff were nice enough and helpful when we asked them questions! The bar good enough for a drink before going out! The room was small but clean and serviced daily! The shower was a bit rubbish but did it's job - just about. Airconditioning and TV worked fine, there's safes in the room for a 5 Euro /day charge. A word of warning most hotels are subject to a 6% city tax and The price I was quoted didn't include breakfast (another 10 Euros per person per day)... it was worth it though! 4 Stars mainly because of the location but there was little majorly wrong with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location , nice hotel right in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ArianaUP
Reviews.Content: The Luxer is a great small hotel right in the center of Amsterdam . You just step out of the central station and walk for 2 minutes and you're there. The atmosphere in the hotel is very nice, all hotel staff are happy to give advice and help if needed. The rooms are quite small but clean and well equipped, all rooms have shower (those can get a bit messy becuae they're tiny and not very comfortable, we had to wipe the water constantly after using the shower). The breakfast is great, there is no cooked breakfast but the variety is quite good though the breakfast area can be quite crowded at times. At night the breakfast area is used as a bar but its still quiet and great if you feel like having a drink at 2AM all of the sudden. After staying here for a week this would be my choice on my next visits to Amsterdm. One negative point about the service in the hotel - there is an in room safe in every room but using it will cost you 5euro for every day of your stay (we stayed for one week so had to part with 35 euro for this...).

Reviews.Title: “great place, very central”
Reviews.Author: chapels
Reviews.Content: we stayed for just two nights but it was worth it. The hotel is close to all the places we planned to visit. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The staff were very helpful and the fact it had an all night bar was a bonus. I'd would think about staying again if the hotel got a bit of a touch up around the halls and the bedrooms need some attention.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: christine d
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights over queensday. We have stayed in about 5 different hotels in Amsterdam and this was by far the best. The location was ideal, right near the train station and in the heart of the attractions. Room was very clean, quiet and was en suite which I always find to be a great bonus. the beds were comfortable with quilts rather than the usual sheet and blanket. There was a tv and air conditioning unit too, which was needed. Breakfast was very plentiful and didn't finish till 11 which is another plus for me! The staff were really friendly and I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two nights. I arrived Monday morning 11.00 am way too early to check in, which was 2pm. The charming young lady on the reception, told me she would find me a room which was available.. i got a double room for the price of the single i had booked. The staff where very nice, The room was good, TV, Safe, Nice size bed, shower / toilet. Telephone, Air con, lots of electricity points for your various camera and phone recharging, plenty of towels, and wardrobe space. only downside was there was no view from the window, which looked out onto an alley way - right into some ones apartment.. The room was on the second floor rm 205, it was served by an elevator. the door entry is by card, and you also use this card to power the room electricity supply..by placing in a wall slot. Although i did not see a baggage room as such, you could leave your bags in the hotel, until you where ready to leave or check in..but only placed on the floor, by the elevator.. The hotel has a reception desk, and bar combined. The bar is open 24 hrs.. i did not have breakfast, but fellow guests said it was fine. the hotel front door is electronically controlled from the front desk to keep out any unwanted people. All in all i enjoyed my stay and would stay again. The location is great also, its about a five minute walk from Amsterdam station,

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy twin room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe81
Reviews.Content: It has a good location in the centre. The problem is that every time I walked out of the hotel I was offered some drugs by what can only be described as seedy characters. We stayed with some friends who shared a double room which was reasonable with two windows to allow for plenty of light. However our twin room was very dark and dingy. Now I have quite high expectations from hotels not really going below 4 star accommodation so you can imagine how I felt to walk into a cold dark room to find that there were no doors on the cupboard, the hanger rail had been broken off, cigarette ash on the floor along with a crisp packet under the bed, stained bedding and a view of empty bottle crates. The double room was adequate but I felt that the twin was neglected and presumed that it would only be used by drunken louts that donâ€™t care about where they stay. To add insult to injury we were charged an extra 5 euros a night for the privilege of our twin. There is no soundproofing in the hotel! It was expensive just like everything in Amsterdam, I only last month came back from Krakow where we stayed for four nights In 4 star Novotel Centrum for the same price. Not only was the Hotel far superior but so was the place. If you want dingy hotels, drugs, hookers and expensive crap food and drink then Amsterdam is the place for you. On the other hand if you want somewhere nice, cultural, with beautiful food and drink at rock bottom prices, more nightlife that you can shack a stick at and more importantly class!! Then why not try Krakow? I will be honest I donâ€™t like Amsterdam but I must say that I did have a good laugh and if you just want somewhere to lay your head then Hotel Luxer should suffice.

Reviews.Title: “best so far”
Reviews.Author: postglyn
Reviews.Content: just arrived back from luxer have stayed in amsterdam 4 times now and this was the best so far , friendly and helpful staff, close to everything, great breakfast plenty of choice to start the day bar open 24 hours so you can get drinks anytime of the night or day, not like some places we have stayed, like it so much we came straight home and booked again to go in may 2007.only thing rooms a bit small but clean and tidy but what more do you need at really good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Valentine Break”
Reviews.Author: LadyDeathstryke80
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend just got back from a Valentine break... What an amazing little hotel this is....right in the heart of everything...but not sat on top of the red light district. Our room was lovely and clean...the staff are friendly too....the breakfast was also spot on. This hotel is complete value for money...I really cant fault it. My girlfriend and I are thinking of returning in early August for Gay Pride...and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Craic!”
Reviews.Author: FinnIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay in this Hotel, the staff especially Nataile made the whole weekend break even more enjoyable, its like walking into a home away from home, very central location, rooms clean, breakfast good, short walk to all the main areas, first time in Amsterdam but we are definetly going back and we will definelty be heading back to the luxer, would strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Deal”
Reviews.Author: triumphant
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Luxor, and it is just the same. Very friendly staff, hotel reception is clean, well decorated, warm and welcoming. I noticed when we booked this hotel it was classed as a 1 star, last time we stayed here is was a 3 star. While i dont agree with it being a 1 star, it is a very high 2 star or average 3 star. We got a very good deal of Â£120 for two people for 2 nights, including breakfast and city tax, which considering its location is very good. Location is right in the heart of the city, red light district is around the corner, good range of places to eat a stones throw away, as are cafes. It can get very busy outside and if you get a room over looking the street it can get noisy, but we had asked for a room at the rear and got it, which made a huge difference. The rooms are well laid out, nothing grand, but clean and comfortable, the bathroom we had was great, continetal style, walk in shower with endless amounts of hot water, and i mean hot, with a shower that if put on full blast will knock you over( ideal after a cold wander around the city) Breakfast is served until 11am, which suits us, no need to fall out of bed early !! Breakfast is as you would find in any other hotel, cheese, smoked meats, boiled eggs, selection of bread and rolls, jams etc, all very nice, very fresh. The coffee is great, just what is needed to wake you up. It has been mentioned in other reviews aboutthe size of the breakfast area, yes it is a little cramped, but no worse than other hotels, and if the breakfast area is full then you can use the tables up around the bar. If anything it is better up there as you can watch the world go past as you eat breakfast. The doors of the hotel are locked, this is to keep out the riff raff, and should by no means put you off, just press the buzzer and door is buzzed open, but to be honest we never had to buzz as there is always some one at reception. To sum the Luxor up, cracker of a little hotel, well worth the money !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my short stay”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxer for one night (January 16th), on my way back from Prague to the United States. I have been to Amsterdam three times before (all in 2005) and love the city and new the area. It is blocks from Dam square and a five minute walk from Central Station. It is about a block away from the red-light district but not in the middle of it and not a bad location at all, I wouldn't want to stay in the middle of the red-light district. It is close to all kinds of restaurants and bars (and coffee shops of course if that's your thing... though it's not mine). The lady at the reception when I checked in was very friendly and check in was very quick. I learned, which I would have prefered to know ahead of time, that they charge 5 Euro more if paying by credit card, fortunately I had enough cash on me. This could be the fault of the site I booked with though, so I won't count it against the hotel. I do prefer to pay hotels wtih a card when possible in case of problems after I return home but do think 5 Euro is a bit much. I had requested a non-smoking single room not facing the street when I booked and got a smoking room with two twin beds which did not face the street. The smell of smoke wasn't that bad so I decided not to ask for a new room, plus I was only there for one night and I wasn't going to be back in the room until late after a night out so it wasn't a big deal. The room and the bathroom themselves were clean, except for the carpet which really needs to be replaced, it is stained probably from so much use. There were scuff marks on some of the walls so it could probably have used a paint job as well. Other than that the room was fine and most importantly like I said it was clean (except for the carpet). The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows. The satellite TV did have a few English channels wihch was nice as my hotel in Prague did not. Again, I wasn't there to watch TV but it's nice to have a channel or two you understand when getting dressed, etc. I had heard about the bells from the old church in the area so I brought ear plugs and it wasn't an issue when I slept. Be sure to have them though because the bells do ring and might keep you up, of course by the time I got to bed I was exhausted anyway. Didn't have time for breakfast in the morning so can't comment on that. One thing that I didn't appreciate much was the cleaning lady in the morning coming around at 10:15 knockin on everyone's door who was checking out that day to let everyone know check out was at 11:00. I hadn't planned on waking up for another 15 minutes but oh well. Overall, though it was a short stay I would stay here again, but next time I would probably ask for a non-smoking room I had requested. It is a great location and the tram will get you anywhere not within walking distance that you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dicksurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the luxer 15th - 18th December 2006. Only a 5 minute walk from central station, this hotel is on a pedestrian street, full of bars, restuarants, coffee shops, and shops, just on the edge of the red light district. Dam square is a short walk further on. Our room, on the 3rd floor, was clean, warm, and basically furnished. Our view from the windows were of amsterdam rooftops. The bathroom was also very clean. I was very impressed with the buffet breakfast which was included in the room price. It was quite informal, and I felt that nobody would have cared if we sat drinking coffee there for hours. The staff are friendly and helpful, the bar is open 24 hours, and despite being in a lively part of town, it is a quiet and relaxed hotel, with a definate "dutch" feel. I have visited amsterdam many times, and the Luxer hotel is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loving The Dam!”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Emma
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying here with my best mate for Friday and Saturday night. We went on a lads weekend and weren't looking for 5 star luxury! We've been to Amstardam a few times now and this hotel has a brilliant location, right in the middle of the red light, with plenty of bars and coffe shops to idle away your time in! Everything is in walking distance which we loved as we certainly couldn't have driven!! Anyway, back to the Hotel!
