The hotel was clean and perfect for what we wanted (Just a bed basically) however, the shower was crap as it needed de-scaling (simple as that!) but I just couldn't get any water to direct onto me! The other down side was noisy mornings, when we wanted to lay in and recover there was constant noise and doors banging in our corridor. Admitadly this was self inflicted head aches! We never got to see breakfast so couldn't comment on that! The bottom line is that I would stay there again for it's ease and location but would take ear plugs and would check the shower before un-packing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for singles!”
Reviews.Author: TOKYONIGHTS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Luxer for four nights. It was in great location, next to the red light district. We were able to walk from the train station with all our luggage (5min walk). The room was comfortable, very clean with a small bathroom. they had AIR CONDITIONING but we didn't use it although it was summer. The Dam square is really close and you can find all kind of restaurants, coffeshops (The Grasshopper) and sex shops in the same street (Warmoesstraat). I recommend it to everyone, don't forget to visit Heineken Experience. Bye.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient central location, and none of the sleaze”
Reviews.Author: FemaleNomad
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a week in Amsterdam, staying at the Luxer. It's less than 5 minutes walk to the central station, making it a great base for exploring Amsterdam and its surrounding areas. The hotel is located on the north western edge of the red light district. However, there are no brothels in the immediate surroundings of the hotel, nor on the route to central station. Therefore, don't worry even if you are easily offended. The area is very safe, even for a single woman travelling alone. My room is on the 2nd floor at the back, so I haven't experienced any noise problem mentioned by other reviewers. (The area is very lively, so noise might be a problem if your room faces Warmoesstraat). The back street is not pleasant looking, but nothing worse than I expect from a busy city town center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: luvofholidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Luxer for one night. It was in great location and our room was very clean. I have to admit the outside view was not too pleasant but it only mattered the hotel was clean to me. We only had an overnight stay at the Luxer because we were on our way to Canada and we had a friend with us who had never been. So the location was great, close to everything. We even were able to walk from the Train Station with all our luggage. Only about a 5-10min walk. The room was comfortable, not on the large side but it was fine. Very small bathroom as well but also fine. I would definately recommend this hotel to travellers who want clean, comfortable hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my 8 hour stay...”
Reviews.Author: JeffCali
Reviews.Content: I arrived one night to sleep and catch my plane in the morning... I went to a hotel agency, they wanted 10 euro plus 2 euro fees to reserve it... so I said I'll be back, went there direct and got the room for 20 euros cheaper... then bargained a little to 30 euros cheaper than the initial place (so bargain when you go there, especially if you're single you can use that as an excuse). The T.V. didn't work but they had AIR CONDITIONING which a lot of hotels don't have there.. and it is essential during July. Good location, close to the red light district and pretty safe. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DerylDowling
Reviews.Content: What a great spot, on the edge of the Red Light District, very close to the main train satation and staff that are very helpful. Amsterdam is very expensive for accommadation so this is very good value. Rooms were a bit dark but not a problem. We were up early and the staff always got us a coffee or tea well before breakfast and would sit and give advise on what to see and where to go. Our rooms were very quiet and and we felt very safe with 24 hour reception with the door locked at night. We has a ball my wife and I are in our forties and my in-laws in their late sixties and we found this a great spot to explore Amsterdam from. Pleant of places to eat in the same street and dam square only 10 minute walk. The two guys who do the late shift were great, one was American basketballer and I am involved in BB as well so we got along great and the other guy was a local and he was very helpful as well. Deryl & Fiona Dowling Tasmania Australia

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: leitrimlassI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Luxer for 4 nights on the 22 june, If you want a clean friendly hotel in an excellent location and are not fussy about frills then the Luxer is your hotel. It has excellent security, The bar is open 24 hrs and the staff are laid back and friendly. Couldnt believe the great location on a pedistrian street which is full of cafes ,bars and restrauants .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, ideal location but noisy room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend booked me this hotel and my flights as a surpris for my birthday in January. I automatically fell in love with Amsterdam and I am definatly going back to visit again next January. The Hotel Luxer was clean, spacious rooms, cheap, laid back although efficient and in the perfect location but our room was soooo noisy during the night and I dont mean the noise coming from outside either it seemed to be the hotels heating and air con systems that made our room incredibally noisy through the night. Luckily I was rather intoxicated with alcohol that it didnt really bother me. I would love to stay in this hotel again but will not go back simply for the fact of the noisy room!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!! unless you are a gambler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through AmsterdamBy [""] 2 months before going, and phoned in 3 days prior to our arrival, to confirm our booking. When we got there, we were blankly told that we didn't have a booking. Upon production of our internet voucher, we were then told that the hotel was overbooked and our room had been given away. (The same happened to 10 other people on the same night.) Astonishingly, the staff could hardly be bothered or even be sorry. Clearly the agent we booked through does not bring them enough business... In all fairness, we were offered the possibility to go to another hotel, run by a friend of the manager at Luxer. People there were absolutely lovely, although the location was dreadful for us and the standards of our room had nothing to do with what we had booked in the first place, although of course it was more expensive... Hotel Luxer staffs know exactly what they are doing, benefiting from the large numbers passing by, in the relaxed knowledge that one tourist replaces another.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel luxer this time last year. We actually arrived on queens day and it was mayhem but the hotel was easy to find very near central station and the people were extremely helpful and friendly from the start. The room we got was large and comfortable and we could look out the window on to the main street below. The hotel was in a great location once your not bothered about being close to the red light district. We found it to be an excellent location and found the hotel to be of better standard than most in that area from what we heard. The hotel felt very secure even though it was right in the centre of things and it was nice to be able to come in to the hotel and know that the door was locked and you and your belongings were secure. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. It is not luxury but it definitely serves its purpose for a city break as it is a clean comfortable and friendly hotel. I will return if i am in Amerstdam again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam, we were very impressed with the size and cleanliness of our room. Ideal location. The breakfast wasnt the best but adequate.Most of the staff are very friendly and helpful, giving you ideas of where to eat/drink. Jeff, the receptionist who works the night shift is an brilliant person, he couldnt help us out enough after two of our party had a little too much of the .......Would definately recommend and return to the Hotel Luxer.

Reviews.Title: “Turns out, service can make a difference.”
Reviews.Author: Showboat1
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this place a great review. The location was superb, on Warmoesstraat on the outskirts of the RLD. It's a short walk from Centraal Station and Dam Square. The hotel was clean, inviting and warm, with a private bar that stayed open all night. Breakfast was a fresh assortment of meats, breads, cheeses, fruits and more. So everything was great. Until the heat in our room went out. For 3 nights. Burr. The problem wasn't necessarily the lack of heat (though yes, it was cold) or even my and my wife's resulting sore throats and runny noses. It was that with the exception of one employee, no one at the hotel cared. At all. No apologies. No "can we offer you another room, or at least some extra blankets?" No "we're working to fix it." Nothing. Now, I say no one cared with one exception. Not sure it's cool to mention names, but "J" was awesome. Extremely helpful, and easily the nicest person we met on our entire trip. They should hire a half dozen more like him. Anyway, I hate it when people use these reviews to whine about service. So I'm not gonna list every little complaint in detail. Frankly, we probably would have overlooked or forgotten most of the bad service and attitude, had there not been such complete apathy when a real problem (the heat) arose. Honestly, you'll probably stay here and love it. If you're just looking for a place to crash between tourist stops and bars, it doesn't get much better. For us, the little things just added up in the face of a problem. When we checked out after 4 nights, the lady announced that our only additional charges were 2 Euro for the phone. After refusing to add it to my credit card because she "would prefer to have the Euros," she handed me a small contact card for the Luxer, almost as an afterthought. "Please remember us next time," she said. I will, lady.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but in the red light district”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Luxer for 3 nights in February. We paid 70 euro/night and for that price, the hotel was very good. We chose it because it would allow us to walk to all the places we wanted to see, but it ended up being right in the middle of the red light district, so we were constantly surrounded by post-teen tourists crowding the coffeeshops, and drug pushers. Not so good aspects: *It would be really great if I could walk down the street to the hotel at the end of the day without being offered heroin or cocaine multiple times. It really gets annoying and kind of ruins the great atmosphere that exists everywhere else in the city. *The reception at the hotel is also the bar, so it is always really smoky *Our room stank of smoke when we first got there despite booking a non-smoking room. It took a couple of days of open windows to get rid of the smell. *There is a lack of decent food nearby, most of it is levelled at people coming out of coffeeshops, we had to go pretty far to find a fresh meal. Positives: *I actually found the staff to be really helpful, they were fairly pleasant. *Rooms are a good size- lots of floorspace for luggage, table and chairs, comfy beds. The bathrooms are not big, but are very good and the shower is very good. TV has a good range of channels. *Great breakfast- breads, cereals, juices, coffee machine, cake, pastries, fruit, cold meats. Good variety and a good start to the day. *We were able to walk everywhere from there- Anne Frank house, museums, canal tours, Heineken Experience, and the train station is about a two minute walk away. *Internet and a laundromat are both on the same street, a couple of doors down and across the street. So overall, it wasn't so much the hotel that was a problem, just the area it's in. If you are planning to visit coffeeshops the whole time it would be perfect, if you want to see some sights you can walk everywhere from here, but be aware you will be in a dodgy area. Not so much unsafe, just dodgy. As for the hotel itself, it's excellent value if you pay a lower rate as we did- if it were in a different area, I would definitely consider staying there again. I would still recommend this hotel, mainly to student and/or budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Base Camp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from Amsterdam for a short break - and spent 3 nights at the Luxer. I'd say the star rating is dependent on what you need from a hotel. We just wanted a central crash pad; specifically since we were on a whirlwind visit. The hotel is uncomplicated and unfussy; you won't find luxury, but you will have a good place to put your feet up. We found it excellent value for money and had a good start to the day with the breakfast buffet, which was generous without being lavish. I would recommend bringing your own pillow with you if you have strict pillow requirements: we only got one flat little pillow each, which wasn't very comfortable. Also, we had a shower that did more of a steam action rather than washing with water - very fine spray. Not sure if we just got unlucky with that, but it didn't ruin our stay. If you're looking for a central, convenient place, I'd definitely recommend it. But don't be snobby - if you are, then go upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahWexford
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Luxer with two friends for three nights. It was a very welcoming hotel with friendly atmosphere. The rooms were clean and spacious and bathroom spotless. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend it. Its a tourist class hotel in an excellent location for sightseeing, near the station and canals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel!! My boyfriend and I stayed from 31st jan to 3rd feb and could not recommend hotel luxer enough. It was 3 mins walk from central station. The staff were really friendly, we had our room cleaned and fresh towels all the time. There was a 24 hr bar and the breakfast was really good. - O/J / Coffee, fresh bread, fruit, cheeses, jams. We had a smoking room and had no trouble with alarms!! It was right in the heart of warrmostratt so central to EVERYTHING! we are going back to amsterdam this year and will be staying here again and have recommended it to friends !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Missing Amsterdam already”
Reviews.Author: EmmaB120272
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a fews days in Amsterdam I can honestly say that i'm missing it already. The Hotel Luxer was such a lovely hotel with pleasant staff, good morning breakfast and knowing that the hotel is secure made our stay perfect. The sound of the church bells was lovely (once you got used to them) The Hotel is just around the corner from the red light district, 5 minutes walk from Central Station and Dam Square and is surrounded by an abundance of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Amsterdam is such a lovely place and We will surely be going again in the near future, hopefully in the summer. The weather is very much like England. The only thing that was scary were the beggers and pimps. Also be wary, you will be offered all kinds of things whilst walking down the streets, especially around the red light district. Ladies leave you handbags at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RonLynda
Reviews.Content: I visited the Luxer in October with my wife and two of our friends. Great location, easy to get to and ideally placed for many restaurants and bars. Dam square only 10 minutes walk and the main shopping street the same. Canal boats also within 5 mins, highly recommend this trip. The museums (Van Gogh etc) are further out and too far to walk to really. The hotel is clean, basic but ideal for a four day break like ours. Friendly, helpful staff who helped make our stay enjoyable. Good breakfast included. Well done the Luxer

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Issor
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 19th-20th Nov. Everything very clean. Staff very nice and really willing to help. Breakfast very well too. Good size in bedrooms (not too small, not too big) In general, a very good opinion for a good-price hotel in a very good location. I recommend it and in case one of my friends or myself go to Amsterdam again, we will stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: AnaPucela
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Luxer with my husband and all I can say is that the place is fantastic. We were given a clean and nice room with a spotless toilet. Breakfast was fresh and good. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Luxer”
Reviews.Author: MaxieBaby
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at the Luxer and can recommend this for the price. Staff were helpful and the cleaners did a great job, everything was sparkling and clean fluffy towels were left every day. I left my bag in the breakfast room on our last morning(with passports, tickets, credit cards, camera and money in it!!!) and when I realised, after about half an hour, I became a little agitated to say the least when I went to look for it and it was no longer there! The maid heard me and calmed me down, took me back to the breakfast room and found my bag which had been taken into the kitchen for safe-keeping, she was brilliant. Although there was no view from our room it was quite big and fairly quiet. The fact that the hotel was on the edge of the Red Light District was not a problem-we didn't feel threatened or worried and there were some great restaurants nearby. It was very central for all the sights and we would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth choosing”
Reviews.Author: ant08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Luxer for 4 nights. Have to say the hotel has exceeded my expectations. First, it has a great location - very close to the rail way station and at the same time on a rather small street with not much traffic. The street is really close to Red-light district and has a variety of shops that can shock anyone. But that is the charm of it. From the hotel one needs 5 min to get to the Dam square, 15 min - to the main museums and 5 min to the station. Lots of restaurants and eating places available. Room was really clean and spacious for 3 star hotel. Bed was good, sheets - matching the highest expectations. Plenty of towels that were changed every day. Most of the windows look into the small path between the hotel and the next house which is good because of less noise. My view on the 2 nd floor was to the roof of the neighbor building. Some views on the ground floor can be rather ugly. The only problem I found was that the shower nozzle was so high (at about 2.4 meters) so that I can hardly reach it on tiptoes. There was a controllable air-conditioner in the room. Breakfast was really nice but no hot dishes - ham, cheese, bread, jams, serial, boiled eggs and fruits. I found it quite good. Since the building is rather narrow the hall and the breakfast room are rather small. In general, quite pleasant experience and good value for money. Great location for those who want to be close to night life attractions in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gaglierto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located on a busy street on the outskirts of the RLD. Very easy to walk to from Central Station, short walk to Dam Square. Heck, we even walked to the Heineken museum from the hotel ! :) It seemed very safe despite all the shady characters who lurk in the RLD selling hard drugs. The main entrance is locked and you have to be buzzed into the hotel at night. We found the room to be very clean and the bathroom spotless. The maid service was very good as we stayed multiple nights and they brought in clean towels. The window looked into the back alley but we never wanted to stare out the window to take in the sights ! Who cares what the view is ? :) (just make sure you don't stay on the ground floor, we were on the 2nd floor and it was fine) The breakfast buffet was good and the woman in charge did a great job of making sure the buffet was fresh and stocked. We do not agree with the sight of fruit flies at all (as referenced to by a previous post). A double room can be had for around 80 Euros which is reasonable considering the location. I've seen a lot more expensive rooms that did not seem as nice. There are tons of coffeshops and pubs around and it's within walking distance of major stops. Bottom Line: I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please ignore any negative reviews about this hotel I have been to dam over 20 times i have stopped in all star rating of hotel available, like everything in life you get what you pay for. On my last 4 visits (all this year) and my next visit in november for the cannabis cup will be at the luxer. If you are looking for any hotel above a 3star dont waste your time by reading anymore, if however you are looking for a quality 3star look no further, this is the place for you. You couldnt ask for a more convient located hotel. In all my visits all the staff have been friendly, helpful etc.. Granted the view from the rooms isnt the best, and some people might say the rooms are a bit on the small side, but considering all i use my room for is sleeping and cleaning that doesnt bother me. The rooms have always been extremly clean. The breakfast with is included in the price for the room is repetitive but it is fresh and tasty and with it being a buffet style you can help yourself as many times as you want. All in all you cant do any better than staying at the luxer if you are looking for a quality cheap stay in the great city of amsterdam, i hope some of you find this helpful p.s If anyone likes chinese food, you have to check out the mandarin afew doors down, its fantastic authentic and a great price,, the hot and sour soup is my favourite,, mmmmm,,,, enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast...Awful View”
Reviews.Author: Shazhudson
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel on 5 Sept 2005 for 3 nights with my boyfriend. I found the lady on reception to be a little unfriendly and when I asked her a question she would look as though she could not be bothered answering. Isn't that what reception is there for? Our room was pretty clean and the bathroom spotless. The view from the room was awful, it looked in to a dingy alley and we had a window opposite which was broken and had a horrible yellow net curtain on...lovely! You had to stick your head out of the window to smoke as the alarm kept going off, and reception called us after about an hour of arrival about this, it's not a non-smoking hotel so why this happened is beyond me. It was very noisy at night, with people slamming doors and we had noisy neighbours too!! Partying until all hours of the morning so I had to buy some earplugs as I had about 2 hours sleep on the first night. On a positive note, the breakfast was very good. I loved the breads and cheese and they do a damn good coffee! I wouldn't stay here again...this was my 5th visit to amsterdam and this was my least favourite hotel. We've booked to celebrate new year and staying in the Singel Hotel. Hope to have a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “5 star for 3”
Reviews.Author: divadiver
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews was apprehensive about staying, needn't worry. The hotel was clean and friendly. Breakfast was plentiful: bread, bread rolls, butter, jams, ham, cheese, turkey, cereal. Wouldn`t advise eating the boiled eggs, the same eggs seemed to be in the basket during our stay!! Our room was clean, we stayed for three nights, towels were changed and room cleaned during our stay. Even gave extra pillows. There are no tea making facilities here so take your kettle, tea bags, etc. Reception is managed 24/7. Certain times during the day, you have to be buzzed in. Although we did not get charged for leaving our bags after check-out, they are left at the other end of the bar, unsecured.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good price”
Reviews.Author: petrjarv
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with my friend. We had a double room with one bed. Price was 90â‚¬ per night. Location was good, only couple minutes walk to Central Station and to Dam Square. Also the Red light district was very near. Warmoesstraat is a busy street full of coffee houses, pubs, porn stores and cheap hotels. Hotel room was clean and good. There was TV with foreign channels (BBC, ZDF...). Breakfast was just a basic cold buffet. Nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “double booked but service great!”
Reviews.Author: vinny_0
Reviews.Content: we arrived on 29th August, having booked the hotel in May, to be greeted by a pleasant receptionist telling me "we have a problem". having looked forward to this mini-break for weeks, you can imagine how our hearts sank! the hotel had double booked and it was due to some guests having pre-paid, and others like us who hadn't. we'd not been given the option to pre-pay when booking. However, the receptionist lady went on to give us the solution she'd sorted, which was moving to a hotel a little bit down the same street, negotiating a 10 euro a night discount (which was actually 45 euros off the usual price!!), getting us into the best room, and giving us free drinks on the house that night!! the hotel we were moved to was a little more basic, but the view was right over the dam and main dam street. Gotta say it was brilliant. So although i can't review hotel, i can say the service we received from the receptionist was fantastic. with the savings we made on the price, we went to a [---] show! so it all worked out in the end!! the street the hotel is on, is really cool with loads going on in the day and at night. lots of interesting people and "sights" to see!! and we're a mid-30's married couple (14 years) who had a fab time in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Really good clean hotel - noisy doors though!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Luxor Hotel, found it really really nice. The staff were lovely and friendly and the rooms, although they were small - particularly the tiny bathroom, were spotlessly clean. It is in an ideal location for the partying part of Amsterdam - our room was to the middle of the hotel so we were not bothered by any outside noise. The doors on the rooms need to be sorted though - they bang so loud! Still after a night out you tend not to hear them too much!! All in all a really great wee hotel, very reasonable and clean and comfortable. Oh and a great breakfast! Would have no problem recommending it at all. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: srochette
Reviews.Content: I paid E100 (E105 with a credit card) and to be honest I think that was about E40 too much. When we got to Amsterdam via train we headed over to the hotel by foot, you don't need a taxi or anything. The neighborhood where the hotel is located is right on the Red Light District, so if you know what you are expecting its not that bad. True, the front desk is also the bar and when we got there, there were about 5 or 6 guys drinking up a storm and it was pretty smokey. The room we had was up on the 3 floor (the American 4th), the ceiling was angled as it was part of the roof and our bathroom ceiling was the same. The desk staff at check-in was terrible she never smiled or wished us a pleasant stay. When we went out for dinner and we passed right by the desk and tried to make eye contact she never looked up or said anything to us and the same was true on our return. The morning staff was much nicer. The breakfast was excellent!!! Hotels need to remember (no matter how small or large) service is key and a simple "hello", "goodbye", "how can I help you", "have a nice evening/day" etc... goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Lux”
Reviews.Author: Blue_moo_cow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxer with my boyfriend and booked the hotel because of the great location. We arrived at the hotel and tried to check in but the man at reception claimed that we had already checked in. Eventually he realised that he had made a mistake and booked somebody else in under my name. We got up to our room and things didn't get much better. It was a dingy grimy room with dirty marks all over the walls and it was tiny. There were ceiling tiles missing and we were right next to the lift, so it was quite noisy. The view looked out onto the back of other buildings and the shower room was just a joke. It was like an obstacle course to get to the loo as the sink overlapped considerably. Anyway, I was there to be in Amsterdam not the hotel room. The location was amazing and the breakfast was a cold buffet but very good! Staff at the hotel were not very helpful and the bar doubled up as the reception. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: mj_senior
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just 2 minutes walk from the Central Rail Station (walk...don't get taxi !). Close to bars and restaurants and myself and my partner always felt very safe. No suggestion it was in the middle of a gay area... so what if it was .... and I am a 'straight' guy ! The hotel is open 24/7 and security is good as entry is only available through the main front door that is reception operated. The rooms that we saw were excellent...clean...spacious ... excellent air con (quiet) .... plenty of hot water ... clean towels daily .... room serviced daily .... TV with at least 50 channels (many in English) ... security safe in the room..... even plug adapters in the room for UK to European supply. Breakfast was served from 8am-11am and there was always plenty of good food for every taste and plenty of staff topping up supplies. The staff themselves were always on hand for anything we required and were helpful and polite. I really cannot fault this hotel in any way and would not hesitate to recommend it to anybody going to Amsterdam looking for a low cost 'no frills' type of deal, although I have to say I have often paid more and received far less in other hotels in Amsterdam and around the world. We will be back that is for sure... I wouldn't look anywhere else ! Anybody want any further help... do not hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as before, but still O.K.”
Reviews.Author: lippi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxer a couple of years ago and could not really find much fault with it for the price. Much remains the same--the breakfast is good and in a nice comfortable area, the location is great--a short walk from the main train station, and the room size adequate. They have, however, started to think of ways to nickle and dime the customers. The internet access used to be free in the lobby, now it's 30 cents a minute. The bag storage used to be free and now is 2.50 a bag. Also, there is a 5 euro charge for using a credit card to pay your bill. None of this was mentioned until I got there. Also the place is starting to show its age a bit. All that said, I think it still represents a pretty good deal for a very central location in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my girlfriend, brother and sister-in-law, couldn't really fault it to be honest. The location is great being just a few minutes from Central Station. The 2 of us had the room on the top floor, nice size room and bathroom was fine apart from the shower which is set too low due to the low ceiling in there. The street its on is fine, lots of coffeeshops along it, fast food, cake shops and the Red Light District is the next canal over which is always good fun to walk around. If your sensible and streetwise then you wont have a problem with any of 'dodgy' guys that hang around the area. Breakfast wasn't anything special, selection of cereals, coffees etc. Staff were very helpful and sorted any issues we had.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CB_N_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We (my sisters, mum and niece) stayed at the Luxer for 3 days earlier this month and had an excellent time. The hotel is in a central location, a few minutes walk from Centraal station and Damrak however it is rather close to some of the risque shops associated with the red light district (although suggesting that it is IN the RLD is misleading). Warmoesstraat itself is quite a pleasant street with a few bars, coffeeshops and restaurants as well as the shops that I mentioned earlier. One street across is the start of the RLD but during the day this is still a pleasant area for a quiet drink and some v. interesting people-watching!! Amstelkring (Our Lord in the Attic museum) is just around the corner and well worth a visit; no-one could imagine what lies behind a fairly uninspiring facade. The hotel is easy to find despite not having much in the way of frontage; it's a typically narrow building with quite a dark reception area - lots of red paint and dark wood. There's a little bar area (more expensive than surrounding bars and little in the way of atmosphere but pleasant enough for a drink before or after a night out) and the reception staff are helpful and informative. Check in was a very speedy process even though we arrived before our check in time of 2pm. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor at the back of the building so no view but also no street noise. Rooms were clean and fairly well-maintained; not particularly spacious but contained everything we required for our short stay (no tea/coffee making facilities however we brought our own supplies incl. cups and the chambermaid was kind enough to bring us a kettle which bizarrely had a UK 3-prong plug). Breakfast and city tax were included in the room price (â‚¬90 per night for a double and â‚¬150 per night for a triple); this certainly wasn't the case with most of the hotels that I looked at. Breakfast was a typically continental affair with cooked ham, turkey, cheese, cucumber, tomato, lots of freshly-baked bread, fruit, cereal, juice, tea/coffee etc. The breakfast area is a little cramped and very dark and tables had to be cleared by one member of staff (there was no option for guests to clear their own tables as dishes had to be taken directly into the kitchen) so sometimes this area was a bit messy. Overall, we had a lovely stay and I'd be happy to book this hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is located on the noisy street in the gay district. This area is not safe. Secondly, personal seemed to be slightly tight. Also, when we asked to leave our baggage for couple of hours after checkout, they said we should pay, although it usually costs nothing. Thirdly, our room was quit small and uncomfortable. I can say nothing bad about breakfast at the hotel; also rooms were quite clean, but still the hotel left a very bad impression. I would not recommend the hotel, especially for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Caz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a weekend in Amsterdam. We arrived by train and it was literately a 3 minute walk from central station. Once we entered the hotel we were pleasantly surprised with how nice the place was. The room was really nice, very clean and ready when we arrived (it said on the website we booked it on that the room wouldnâ€™t be ready till 14:00) and the staff was unbelievably helpful. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, it really was a great weekend and a fantastic hotel. We highly recommend this hotel and we will be booking another stay later this year!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: hayleynphil
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Amsterdam yesterday. Our stay at the Hotel Luxer was a very, very enjoyable stay. Very clean, friendly staff and a great location. We arrived at the hotel at 11am on our first day to drop our bags in reception as the check-in time is at 2pm. We were given our room key and offered breakfast which was a great bonus as we could eat and freshen up after traveling! We highly recommend this hotel and we will be booking another stay later this year!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly great people”
Reviews.Author: WyoBus
Reviews.Content: They say that staff can make or break any establishment - budget to 5 star - and the people staffing the Luxer very definitely make this place a gem! Our flight arrived 8:30am and we were at the hotel at 9:30 asking if we could leave our bags and return in the afternoon to check-in. No problem was the response and "by the way, if you have not had breakfast we're still serving so help yourself" Delicious Dutch breakfast buffet - we found more than enough choices to satisfy and as its self-service, quantity is not an issue. After a walk and canal cruise our room was ready by 1pm and we found no fault with it - typical European double room with plenty of hot water for an extended shower! On departure we had to leave at 6:30am for an early flight to London, but Chris, the night receptionist, insisted on getting the breakfast buffet ready an hour early so that we could have yet another excellent breakfast before walking over to Centraal Station (less than 5 minutes - great location). Housekeepers were very friendly and helpful as were all the reception/bar staff. These are great people and a joy to stay with them - we're looking forward to returning to Amsterdam and seeing them all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: StanInLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked with the hotel direct as it was cheaper that Hotels.com and expedia.co.uk The hotel is located just 5 to 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station (which is only 15 mins by train from the airport) on the edge of the Red Light District (but is not surrounded by RLD establishments!). Walking around the area of the hotel felt safe at all times of the day or night (although walking down towards Dam Square - only a 5 minute walk - you do come accross the "Charlie" boys as in most parts of central Amsterdam - just say no!) We walked to all major attractions from the hotel: Boat Tours (at the station) 5 mins, Dam Sq 10 mins, Anne Frank House 15 mins, Heineken Experience 25 mins, Van Gough 35 mins. The hotel itself is decorated well, was clean and tidy and had helpful, polite staff. Our room was a twin room downstairs to the rear of the building. The room was much smaller than the pictures on the hotel website but was still comfortable with a clean bathroom (with shower only). A 21" TV on the wall had a number of channels including BBC News, BBC World and various other UK channels as well as the local channels. The only downside to the room was the lack of natural day light as the room looked out in to a side yard (not throughfare). On our visit, there seemed to be a problem with our air conditioning unit which seemed to make loud noises every so often all night - even when switched off. As we were only there 2 nights we didnt worry about it. Breakfast is served to the rear of the building between the bar area and the lower ground bedrooms. The breakfast area is comfortable and serves Tea, Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Milk, Chocolate Milk & Orange Juice with Ham, Turkey, Cheese, tomato, hard boiled egg & Breads as well as cereal, muesli and sweet cake slices. All in all, good value for money (about Â£50 per night twin room inc Buffet Breakfast), very central close to numerous bars, restuarants, cafes, coffee houses & coffieshops as well as the lively Red Light District, easy walking/wondering to the main attractions or a short tram ride and best of all just a short walk from the station! We flew from the UK with EUJet from Kent International (45 min flight), took the train (15 min journey leaving every 15 mins) and we were there 10 mins after arriving at the station!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Luxer in Amsterdam, and really enjoyed it. We didn't research well, and found out it was on the outskirts of the Red Light District, but that was never a problem. All the loud night activity was a couple of blocks away and did not disturb us. The staff was very friendly and spoke English...the rates were reasonable, the room was small but clean. When we thought our electricity was off in the room, their handy man "Harry" came up and explained to us that we needed to use our door card inside the room to "activate" the electricity. He was such a nice, older Dutch man. Every time he saw us, he would stop and say good morning, or good evening, and chat a little bit. Such a nice man. They have a free breakfast consisting of several different kinds of bread, some meats, cheeses, chocolate milk, hot chocolate, orange juice, espresso, coffee, cereal, etc. Nothing fancy, but it could fill you up. I DO recommend your staying there. Be nice to Harry.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with 7 other friends. we really liked this hotel and thought it was great value for money. the rooms are very nice and the breakfast is very nice also. it is located very central and even though it says it is just off the red light district it is still a good walk away. you dont feel threatened there at all!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ritchie67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here feb 05 this is the 2nd visit to this hotel staff fantastic room was great, location 2nd to none. Central station just a couple of yards away its the next street to the Damrak. plenty of coffee shops on the door step as well as food, you can eat and drink in your room one down side is no tea or coffee facility's in the room (we took our own ) overall well priced for Amsterdam and I would recomened this Hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Average..!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, very clean and OK breakfast. The position is excellent and only a stones throw from central station. The only downside was, that some of the staff could have been more attentive and friendly. We shall probably stay elsewhere next time but still in the same location. Amsterdam is Fantastic, we love it there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Luxer after reading the reviews here and i felt i got very good value for money. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes from Centraal Station and is at the edge of the redlight district. Giving the nature of some of the nearby establishments it may not be the kind of area to take the kids and the lone female traveller may feel a bit uneasy around the area. I am a female traveller and i felt pretty safe around the hotel however the redlight area is only a minute away. If this is likely to offend maybe best book somewhere further away. The place is lovely and clean and the staff are friendly. Breakfast buffet is included in the price and offers a good selection of fresh food. If i return to Amsterdam in the future i would not hesitate to book the Luxer again. Great Value in a fab location

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stef58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October 2004 for three nights. Location was excellent if you are looking to be situated close to all the action. A 5 min walk from central station and also close to the rld and dam square. Room was very small and bathhroom even smaller but considering all we paid we where happy enough. 320 euros for three nights for both of us. Breakfast was plentifull but get there early as the bread rolls soon went. We didn't find the staff all that friendly but did't spend much time at the hotel bar as the drink was very expensive so this did not bother us too much. Would stay in this hotel again. Didn't have much too complain about.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly and Happy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCluggage
Reviews.Content: We are a group of friends who have just spent a wonderful weekend in Amsterdam celebrating our 50th birthdays. The Luxor is very convenient to Central Station,only a 5min walk,and the rest of the city. It is situated on the outer street of the red light district but we never felt threatened at any time even though several of us walked home alone in the early hours of the morning. There are several good bars,cafes and restaurants on the same street. The rooms were fine and well serviced. The hotel has a nice relaxed atmosphere and the staff are very tolerant and friendly. Continental breakfast is served between 8am and 11am which was good. The only small negative is that the corridor walls are painted white and in need of a new coat which gave a slightly poor first impression as the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: redlisab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Oct 4th-7th and found it one of the better hotels for the price paid 280eur for twin room, 3 nights incl breakfast. If you want a 5 star hotel then go elsewhere and pay the huge prices. The hotel was clean and though very close to red light, it was safe. Lots of bars and restaurants on same street as well as coffe shops so one does not have to venture far. The breakfast is superb with plenty of choice and kept well stocked up(breads, ham, cheese, turkey, fruit, jams, madeira cake, biscuits and juice. As for the air conditioning its really not needed, but then again us europeans are not used to having a.c., if ya want to cool down open the window... its not rocket science, but then again some people are never pleased and like to complain. Situated only 5 mins from centraal station. If like me you like to shop jump on train to haarlem (10min train ride, 5.70eur ret) and shop your heart out. The luxer is a lovely small hotel, kept clean and smack bang in the middle of everything. I am returning in Feb again and will continue to do so in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Luxer
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoesstraat 11, Amsterdam 1012 HT, The Netherlands
